person.persName: Philip D. Yeiser (Paducah, Kentucky, attorney, claims agent, and commonwealth’s attorney)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, attorney, claims agent, and commonwealth’s attorney. Lancaster, Kentucky, native. Married to Ellen Durham Yeiser in 1842. Father of David A. Yeiser. Married to Margaret Craig Yeiser. Father of Ella Yeiser, Florence Yeiser, and Henry C. Yeiser. Apprentice carpenter in Boyle County, Kentucky, from 1834 to 1838. Carpenter in Boyle County from 1838 to 1852. Studied law under Judge Bullock and Judge Goodloe in 1853. Admitted to the bar. Moved to Eddyville, Kentucky. Attorney in Eddyville until 1862. Relocated to Paducah, Kentucky. Attorney and surveyor in Paducah in 1862. Commonwealth's attorney for the First Judicial District of Kentucky from 1862 to 1864. Attorney in Paducah from 1864 to 1886. Member of Presbyterian Church. Member of the Republican Party.
